page.title: 02 Villages
page.content:
The three{villages}all appeared in the original{Domesday Survey. Penton {Grafton}had a church and thirty-five people;{ Fyfield,}then Fifhide, had a church and perhaps fifteen souls. There has been some growth in nine hundred years but little enough considering the general change in population.
Smaller communities include{Ragged {Appleshaw}with a recent addition of eight semi-detached houses,{Clanville, {Little Snoddesden}and{Kimpton.} One or two houses cluster at the main road crossing while{Redenham Park}and {Appleshaw House}are of sufficient size to merit inclusion on the large-scale Ordnance Survey map. The network of minor roads that criss-crosses the block appear to follow the earlier lines created by footpaths.
